perturbation.original_text: 3.1. Invoices and Payment. FNW will send Sponsor invoices Sponsorship Fee in -------------------- two (2) monthly installments beginning September 1, 1999. Invoices are payable thirty (30) days after receipt. A five percent (5%) late fee will be added to all invoices which become past due and interest at a rate of twelve percent (12%) per annum will be charged on all balances not paid within thirty (30) days of the date they are due.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.1. Invoices and Payment. FNW will send Sponsor invoices Sponsorship Fee in -------------------- two (2) monthly installments beginning September 1, 1999. Invoices are payable at the discretion of FNW.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific payment terms (30 days after receipt, late fee, and interest rate), the contract becomes vague and potentially violates Washington state law regarding clear and conspicuous disclosure of payment terms in commercial agreements.  This creates uncertainty and allows FNW to change payment terms without explicit agreement, disadvantaging the Sponsor.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Washington State law regarding contract clarity and fair business practices.  While not a specific statute is violated directly, the lack of specificity opens the contract to challenges under general contract law principles of good faith and fair dealing.

FNW agrees to defend, indemnify and hold Sponsor harmless --------------- from and against all claims, suits, liabilities, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorney costs and fees, for injury to, including death of, persons (whether they be third persons or employees of either of the parties hereto) or any loss of or damage to property in any manner arising from or relating to the rights 3. conveyed herein, with the understanding that this obligation shall not apply to, and Sponsor agrees to defend, indemnify and hold FNW and its officers, directors, employees and agents harmless from and against, all losses, claims, suits, demands, actions, liabilities, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorney costs and fees, for injury to, including death of, persons (whether they be third persons or employees of either of the parties hereto) or any loss of or damage to property in any manner arising from the content of any advertising copy supplied by Sponsor or the negligence or intentional misconduct of Sponsor or its officers, employees or agents.
perturbation.changed_text: 6. Indemnification. FNW agrees to indemnify Sponsor. Sponsor agrees to defend, indemnify and hold FNW and its officers, directors, employees and agents harmless from and against, all losses, claims, suits, demands, actions, liabilities, costs and expenses, for injury to, including death of, persons or any loss of or damage to property in any manner arising from the content of any advertising copy supplied by Sponsor or the negligence or intentional misconduct of Sponsor or its officers, employees or agents.
perturbation.explanation: By omitting the full scope of indemnification and defend & hold harmless and reasonable attorney costs and fees for FNW, the contract creates less protection. This change is significant because Washington law has specific requirements for indemnification clauses, and the reduction in scope for FNW's protection introduces legal risk. Washington law states that 'hold harmless' agreements must be explicitly stated with clear coverage.
